content:
Yes, there are several great hiking trails to check out near Barnstaple. Here are some of the best:

1. Tarka Trail - This is a 180-mile circular trail that runs through Barnstaple and the surrounding countryside. It follows the footsteps of the fictional character Tarka the Otter and offers great views of the River Taw and the North Devon countryside.

2. South West Coast Path - This is a 630-mile trail that runs along the coast of South West England, passing through several towns and villages near Barnstaple. The stretch of path near Barnstaple offers panoramic views of the coastline and the Bristol Channel.

3. Braunton Burrows - This is a unique, UNESCO-designated biosphere reserve that features over 30 species of wildflowers and a range of bird species. There are several hiking trails throughout the dune system, varying in length and difficulty.

4. Heddon Valley - This is a beautiful wooded valley near exmoor that is crisscrossed with several hiking trails of varying length and difficulty. The trails lead you through wooded glades, rushing streams, and open moorland.

5. Exmoor National Park - This national park is a 20-minute drive from Barnstaple and offers several hiking trails that wind through the wooded valleys and moorland of the park. 

These are just a few examples of the many great hiking trails near Barnstaple. Be sure to check the local listings or ask locals for recommendations when you visit.
